name: sugar beet production | sugar beet | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/14974/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of sugar beet. The average yield from 2009 - 2012 is 63.7 t/ha. The data are representative for sugar beet production in United States used for the export market. Mineral NPK fertiliser input is 190-33-210 kg/ha. Organic fertilisers applied amount to 6 m3/ha of liquid manure and 5 t/ha of solid manure. Total active ingredients (a.i.) applied as pesticides amount to 6.53 kg a.i./ha.;The dataset was modelled within the project 'World Food LCA database (WFLDB)'. The aim of this project was to provide inventories of a broad variety of agricultural products and processes and to cover for each product at least 50% of the global export market. The share of sugar beet produced in the United States amounts to 13% of the global production (tonnage produced in 2010). The production system regarded in this dataset aimed at representing sugar beet produced in the United States for the export market.;PEF-Quality: data quality rating (DQR) = 2.8 (i.e. good quality). This dataset refers to an average situation; for specific situations exchanges might differ substantially due to site specific parameters

This activity starts with soil cultivation after the harvest of the previous crop.

This activity ends with the harvest of sugar beet at farm gate. The dataset includes all machine operations, corresponding infrastructure, fuel use and sheds. Machine operations are: soil cultivation, sowing, fertilisation, pesticide application, harvesting, and on-farm transport. Further, direct field emissions and land use change are included. Heavy metal uptake by the crop is considered. The inputs of seeds, fertilisers and pesticides as well as packaging of fertilisers and pesticides are considered. The dataset doesn't include emissions from manure storage because these are within the system boundary of animal production.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0113:Growing of vegetables and melons, roots and tubers

processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: If used, extrapolations are documented on the flow level.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: WFLDB Methodological Guidelines for the Life Cycle Inventory of Agricultural Products in the latest version, available at: (Report section: https://v30.ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports). Data sources: Data were categorised from level 0 (L0) to level (L4) as follows: L0 = estimate, proxy; L1 = statistical data (e.g. FAOSTAT); L2 = L1 adapted to crop and country;L3 = literature data or L1 resp. L2 data approved by experts; medium detailing (i.e. kg of total N-fertiliser); L4 = L3 data of high detailing (i.e. portion N-fertiliser types).In this dataset data were obtained for yield: L3; Fertilisers: L4; Pesticides: L1; Machinery: L1/L2; Irrigation: L2. For information regarding the calculation of individual exchanges see supporting documentation WFLDB-Documentation.pdf.

The exchange has been updated from 'ammonium nitrate, as N' into 'ammonium nitrate' and therefore its amount has been scaled (multiplied) from 0.0001 kg by 2.8573 kg of 'ammonium nitrate' per kg of 'ammonium nitrate, as N'. Original comment of the exchange is: Calculated based on literature values or expert estimation: The total amount of nutrient (Personal written communication, Bill Easterwood , Yara, 2015) multiplied by the share of fertiliser type (Personal written communication, Bill Easterwood , Yara, 2015). See supporting documentation 'WFLDB-Documentation.pdf' chapter 'Fertiliser application' for L3 and L4 data  (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).

Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of sugar beet is calculated to be circa 1.03E-04 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: '[thio]carbamate-compound', 'benzimidazole-compound', 'cyclic N-compound', 'glyphosate', 'phenoxy-compound', 'triazine-compound, unspecified'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 2.05E-04 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.

This represent the transport of fertilizers that are directly linked to their supplying activities, to better represent the fertilizer mix of the activity. The total marine transport volume differentiated into major commodity groups based on data from FearnResearch (2001): Fearnley's Annual Review 2000. Oslo: Fearnley/AS, p. 1-78. The category 'Other cargo' accounts for 38% of total maritime transport volume and has been distributed on commodity groups based on the proportions of transport by rail and inland waterways.
The total marine transport volume differentiated into major commodity groups based on data from FearnResearch (2001): Fearnley's Annual Review 2000. Oslo: Fearnley/AS, p. 1-78. The category 'Other cargo' accounts for 38% of total maritime transport volume and has been distributed on commodity groups based on the proportions in the marine import and export of the US in 2001-2010.

Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'sugar beet' is calculated to be circa 6.80E-03 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'ammonium nitrate, as N', 'ammonium sulfate, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'potassium chloride, as K2O', 'potassium sulfate, as K2O', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 1.36E-02 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.

exchanges.description: Calculated value - Freiermuth (2006). See 'WFLDB-Guidelines.pdf', available at https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports. This emission might be overestimated in case of basic soils.
CO2 uptake by biomass

The exchange has been updated from 'inorganic nitrogen fertiliser, as N' into 'urea ammonium nitrate' and therefore its amount has been scaled (multiplied) from 0.0009 kg by 3.3333 kg of 'urea ammonium nitrate' per kg of 'inorganic nitrogen fertiliser, as N'. Original comment of the exchange is: Calculated based on literature values or expert estimation: The total amount of nutrient (Personal written communication, Bill Easterwood , Yara, 2015) multiplied by the share of fertiliser type (Personal written communication, Bill Easterwood , Yara, 2015). See supporting documentation 'WFLDB-Documentation.pdf' chapter 'Fertiliser application' for L3 and L4 data  (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).
Corresponds to 9.5 kg/ha

exchanges.description: This represent the transport of fertilizers that are directly linked to their supplying activities, to better represent the fertilizer mix of the activity. Transport distance based on US BTS Commodity Flow Surveys 1993, 1997, 2002, 2007, US Dep. Of Transportation, Bureau of Transportation Statistics. Of the total road transport, 6% is assumed to be by delivery van for goods with a large share of retail sale, and 3% for goods that are mainly sold via wholesale.

exchanges.description: Calculated value - Freiermuth (2006). See 'WFLDB-Guidelines.pdf', available at https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports.

On-farm transport: Yield (in tonnes) multiplied by the average distance from field to farm. The distance was obtained by extrapolation (modified MEXALCA approach). See supporting documentation 'WFLDB-Documentation.pdf' chapter 'Machinery processes' (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports). Corresponds to 24.3tkm/ha.

1.0737833595e-06 from Calculated value - Freiermuth (2006). See 'WFLDB-Guidelines.pdf', available at https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports.
-2.76e-06 from Sugar beet, heavy metals uptake model
Heavy metal uptake can be excluded by setting the parameter heavyMetalUptakeSwitch to zero.
